purpose: A React component that displays a 404 error page when users navigate to non-existent routes

functions.name: NotFound
functions.core_logic: Renders a 404 error page with error logging and a home page link

variables.name: location
variables.purpose: Stores the current route information from React Router
variables.usage: Used to access the pathname that triggered the 404 error for logging purposes

key_points: Logs error details to console for debugging
Provides a link to return to the home page
Uses React Router's useLocation hook to access the current path
Styled with Tailwind CSS for a clean, centered layout

issues: Uses anchor tag (<a>) instead of React Router's Link component, which causes full page reload
Error logging happens on every pathname change, not just on initial mount
Could benefit from additional information like 'page you were looking for' or search functionality
Hard-coded home path '/' might not work correctly if app is deployed to a subdirectory
